message+desc:
[GIVEAWAY] Experience South East Asia's FIRST 8K 3D Resolution Dome Theatre at Omni-Theatre. Immerse yourself in a 360 degree cinematic experience filled with flying spaceships and terrifying dinosaurs in the 23 meter wide dome screen in super high quality in both 2D & 3D formats!

Omni-Theatre is giving away 5 pairs of tickets to 5 lucky winners worth $28 each!

All you have to do is follow these simple steps:
1. Simply like and share this video on Facebook.
2. Comment here telling us why you want to win.

Contest ends on the 14th of Feburary 2016. Good Luck!:)

Omni Theater - Science Centre Singapore
Address: 21 Jurong Town Hall, Singapore 609433
Opening Hours: 12pm - 6pm

Find out more here: https://www.omnitheatre.com.sg/Omni-Theatre-Singapore-Home

Sorry for the typo on our end. Contest ends on 14 February 2017, not 2016!$$We don't visit science centre as we are staying in the east which will take us 1 hour of train ride to get there. However, we don't mind to spend our 2 hours travelling (back and forth) for the South East Asia's  First 8K 3D Resolution Dome Theatre at Omni-Theatre to immerse ourselves in the 360 degree cinematic experience in the space and land of dinosaurs. Would be great if we are able to win one pair of tickets for the new experience!

message+desc:
Why will Hongkongers eat these sweet glutinous rice balls on #ChineseNewYear?

Indeed! These are called ‚Äòtangyuan‚Äô which, in Chinese, sounds like ‚Äòreunion‚Äô.  The Chinese New Year meal is called the ‚Äòreunion‚Äô meal because all members of the family will get together for it. http://bit.ly/1atWqkJ #HKCNY
comments: Indeed! These are called ‚Äòtangyuan‚Äô which, in Chinese, sounds like ‚Äòreunion‚Äô.  The Chinese New Year meal is called the ‚Äòreunion‚Äô meal because all members of the family will get together for it. http://bit.ly/1atWqkJ #HKCNY$$Dong Zhi is the day when families get together and eat Tang Yuan. A sweet soup made of glutinous rice balls.$$Represent family gathering.$$Because it's good. If you're smart, you'll eat it all year round.$$I'm not Chinese but I love these glutinous desserts, way better than cookies, donuts, and cakes with shitloads of unhealthy ingredients$$Satpal Phutela just walk in any dessert stores where people love to spend time with friends at during night time after dinner..pretty sure they all have it... if you are on hk island..will recommend u to look for it in Tin Hau$$i miss ds cellebration  madam eve and family kong he fat sue !!!!$$for family togetherness$$It's a lust candy, Aphrodisiac, that's why China has so many new born babies everyday. LOL$$HAPPY CHINESE NEW YEAR$$save a little tangyuan for me also, and dont gobble all by yourself.$$I very much like this tangyuan$$Yes! Because I'm having too !$$kung hai fat choi! to all chinese people

message+desc: A UNESCO World Heritage Site is a place that holds outstanding cultural or natural importance to the common heritage of humanity. Can you name any of Korea's ten UNESCO sites? ^ ^unesco korea- Korea Tourism Organization Official website provides various information on all things about  unesco korea.
comments:
‚ÄúJeju Volcanic Island and Lava Tubes‚Äù. This includes Mount Hallasan Natural Reserve, the Geomunoreum Lava Tube System and Seongsan Ilchulbong Peak.$$-Changdeokgung Palace Complex*
-Gochang, Hwasun and Ganghwa Dolmen Sites 
-Gyeongju Historic Areas *
-Haeinsa Temple Janggyeong Panjeon, the Depositories for the -Tripitaka Koreana Woodblocks *
-Historic Villages of Korea: Hahoe and Yangdong*
-Hwaseong Fortress 
-Jongmyo Shrine
-Royal Tombs of the Joseon Dynasty
-Seokguram Grotto and Bulguksa Temple*
-Jeju Volcanic Island and Lava Tubes

*places I visited. 5/10 not bad, isn't it?$$enjoying my time in jeju these last 3 days, just got back from our visit to the sunset peak and  manjanggul cave - one of unesco's world natural heritage.   truly magnificent!!! jeju is <3$$It is a very wonderful to know that UNESCO World Heritage selected 10 cultural heritage sites in Korea. There are some places that I would need to look around....:))

message+desc:
TaxiMonger brings Johor Bahru‚Äôs first taxi booking service through smartphones for trips to Malaysia. Passengers can book for metered taxis whether on adhoc basis or in advance. Exclusively partnered with JB-Tek Bhd to connect passengers in Singapore with the taxi-drivers of JB-Tek Bhd for a service app called as ‚ÄòTrip To Malaysia‚Äô.
Passengers from Singapore would now be able to go to any of the tourists‚Äô destinations, points of interests and key cities in Malaysia through JB-Tek‚Äôs assigned Executive Taxis. The selected destinations offered by TaxiMonger range from as near as Johor Bahru and going as far as Pulau Langkawi. 

For more information, log on to www.taximonger.com

message+desc:
Borobudur: A Wonder of Indonesia History http://indonesia.travel/en/destination/233/borobudur ‚Ä¶ #CentralJava #Sunset #Sunrise #WonderfulIndonesia

The magnificent Borobudur temple is the world‚Äôs biggest Buddhist monument, an ancient site widely considered to be one of the world‚Äôs seven wonders. Built in the 9th century during the reign of the Syailendra dynasty, the temple‚Äôs design in Gupta architecture reflects India's influence on the region, yet there are enough indigenous scenes and elements incorporated to make Borobudur uniquely Indonesian.
comments: One of the best places I visited in Indonesia.  Love Jogjakarta üòÉ

message+desc:
Get a tax refund on your hotel stay! 
Find out how here: http://bit.ly/1qf5hQm
comments:
It says, "...applicable to international visitors who stay in a certified hotel for a total of more than two nights, but less than 30. In order to receive the tax refund, eligible recipients should be scheduled to leave Korea within 3 months from their check-out date." 
It also says, "Only foreign tourists who do not hold a work-related visa or who are staying for more than 6 months are eligible for the Hotel Tax Refund." So this means that 1) we must stay in Korea for more than 6 months, 2) during this period hotel stay in certified hotel must be more than 2 nights but less than 30 nights, and 3) we must leave Korea within 3 months after the hotel check out date. ? Is this correct? Basically most of us regular tourists will not be eligible since we are not likely to stay in Korea for more than 6 months.$$Can we get tax refund if we booked the hotel through the online booking like agoda/hotels.com/booking.com/etc? Or where should we booked the hotel to get the tax refund? Thank you.$$Where can I find it out the certified hotel list?$$Can we pick up the documentation we need from the duty free zone in Incheon Airport?  Will there be a list of certified hotels?  Crossing my fingers that the two I have booked for our trip qualify!  Thanks!$$Where we can find the certified hotel list?$$Stay in korea over 6mths for travel without work?$$Is this at any hotel in Korea?$$staying for 2 nights cannot fax refund??that means stays for at least 3nights in certified hotel right?$$very comfortable and warm!!$$Do you have a full list of certified hotels for reference.. Was it extend to include budget hotels or guesthouse/ motel?$$I assume hotels not in the list do not have tax refund.$$Thanks for yr fast reply :)$$Is the Tax Refund is applicable for tourist who come in group as in follow the tour? if we follow the tour, our stay will be less than 6 months..$$Low Edmund please read . thanks$$Do u have a list of certified hotels participating in this scheme?$$The Tax Refund Eligibilty, on point number one says it is only for visitors saying MORE than 6 months. Uesugi Snow Lantern Festival is held on February 13th and 14th at Uesugi Shrine, Yonezawa City, Yamagata Prefecture.
About 300 lanterns and 1000 lamps are made by snow. The place is full of small lights, and they make sacred scenery. 
You can also enjoy ski, hot spring, and tasty Yonezawa Beef !

From Tokyo to Yonezawa City takes 2 hours and 15mins by JR Yamagata Shinkansen Line!

Anilao, Batangas

What is it like? 
Located in Southern Luzon, just a few hours from Metro Manila, Anilao is a popular weekend getaway for divers and underwater photographers. A few feet into the water and you can already see the exciting marine life that lies beneath!

Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Magellan's Cross, Cebu 

How to Get There:
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. 

Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

What is it?
Magellan's Cross commemorates Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan's first contact with the people of Cebu on April 7, 1521. 

Fun Fact:
The original cross is actually encased within the planted wooden cross you see today, as a precaution against locals who chipped off small pieces for their rumoured healing properties.

Photo by / Headline by:
Jaime Singlador / Magnus Ahmad
comments: Ive been there. And I feel great.$$No, I beg to disagree, Cebuanos are one of the most honest Filipinos I know.$$try to visit here guyzzzzz,,,,,,:-)

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Coron, Palawan

What is it like? 
Coron‚Äôs Kayangan Lake is the cleanest lake in Asia. Here, the warm sea and the cold mountain spring combine to create a pool of clear water perfect for swimming. To add to that, the lake is enclosed by towering limestone mountains. 

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

Fun Fact: 
Kayangan Lake is a 10-15 minute hike through a scenic, tropical rainforest.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Raul Montifar/Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
"We Filipinos invariably associate rice terraces with the famous tourist mountain town of #Banaue. There are actually equally impressive sites, spread throughout the province of Ifugao, where one can wonder at these ancient engineering marvels.

"One of these is the more rustic town of Mayoyao, just a few hours drive from Isabela. Mayoyao's rice terraces are well-preserved and sit picture perfect in the early morning mist. There are plenty of viewing sites around the town where you can enjoy and marvel these renowned heritage sites.

"Along with the rice terraces in Batad, Bangaan (in Banaue), Hungduan and Nagacadan in Kiangan, they comprise the 5 sites of rice terraces in the Philippines inscribe in the prestigious UNESCO World Heritage List."

Follow us on Instagram through @tourismphl to see more stories of fun and adventure from our featured travellers within the Philippines!

Photo courtesy: @jayjallorina on Instagram 
#VisitPhilippinesAGAIN2016
#itsmorefuninthePhilippines
comments: Beautiful country & beautiful friendly culture ;-)$$Alagaan lng its equally beautiful like the rice terraces in Banaue.$$It reflects the Ifugao's craftsmanship and labor. It's our duty to preserve and to protect them.$$That's why it is now officially called "Ifugao Rice Terraces," instead of just "Banaue Rice Terraces."$$Frenz from Ifugao take me there!$$one of my dream to see this,,,$$I need to see all this

Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron is a first-class municipality in Palawan known for its beaches and shipwreck dive spots.

Fun Fact:
Tamilok -- shipworm dipped still-wriggling in spice vinegar -- is a local delicacy. Extreme foodie Andrew Zimmern had some on his television show, Bizarre Foods!

message+desc:
When  Australian travel blogger Alexander Sherack was asked what he hates most about the Philippines, he said: ‚ÄúLeaving. If you‚Äôve ever met someone that‚Äôs travelled through the Philippines, I guarantee that person will beg you to visit the Philippines. It‚Äôs a weird phenomenon but everyone I have met who travelled to this country have said it has been a highlight of any country they‚Äôve ever been to. Funnily enough, now I beg my friends to visit.‚Äù 

To read more on why Alexander loves the Philippines, click the link below!



Read more at http://outoftownblog.com/featured-traveler-alexander-sherack-of-sherackcitybitch-blog/Alexander Sherack of SherackCityBitch.com is an Australian travel blogger who just recently started discovering every corner of the world. He recently left his dream corporate job at a big 4 accounting firm to pursue travelling and starting his own business. Watch his Viral Travel Video about Fishin‚Ä¶

message+desc:
Apl.de.Ap took his friends to discover the beautiful landscapes that the Philippines has to offer! Make sure to watch the video to see all the wonderful places they visited.

#ItsMoreFunInThePhilippinesThe Philippines will always be home, and I feel forever fortunate to call it as such. The people, the food, the sights, it‚Äôs something that everyone has to experience. Recently, I was lucky enough to bring some great friends back to experience the Philippines for the first time, and for others, to become reacquainted with the islands. 

Over the next several months, we‚Äôre going to showcase some of the best that the country has to offer, and see why ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs More Fun in the Philippines.‚Äù 

www.facebook.com/famcore

#ItsMoreFunInThePhilippines #tpbgovph #PhilippineAirlines

Can you believe that this majestic waterfall is located just three hours away from Manila? Called the Hulugan Falls, you can chase this beauty in the town of Luisiana, Laguna. Proof that not all beautiful things are difficult to reach! Don‚Äôt forget to tag your nature-loving friends below.

Photo by Alexis Lim

Close enough in Manila. :)$$I never thought that Philippines has a beautiful falls like that. I wish someday my family can visit that falls on our next vacation.$$I know the place. message+desc:
Where is it?
Banaue, Ifugao

How to Get There:
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc. 

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue.

What is it?
The Banaue Rice Terraces are 2,000 year old terraces that were carved into the mountain by the Ifugao people. 

Fun Fact:
The terraces were built mostly by hand. 

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
Where is it?
University of the Philippines, Diliman, Quezon City

How to Get There:
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.

Or take a boat from any major Philippine port.

Then take a taxi, jeepney or bus to Quezon City.

What is it?
Sorbetes, the traditional ice cream in the Philippines, is commonly peddled by men called ‚Äúsorbeteros.‚Äù They push colorful carts and ring bells to signal their presence. The usual flavors include taro, cheese, and chocolate.

Fun Fact:
Ice cream peddlers have become so popular in Filipino culture, that there's a popular song about them entitled ‚ÄúMamang Sorbetero‚Äù (Mister Ice Cream Man).

Photo by / Headline by:
Rizza Garcia / Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
Samantha Gash, an endurance athlete from Melbourne and a strong advocate for social change, is running across #India to raise funds for education of underprivileged children in India, Samantha will cover nearly 3,800 km from Jaisalmer in #Rajasthan to Mawsynram in #Meghalaya within a period of 76 days. The 31-year-old ultra-marathoner has taken up the #RunIndia project challenge to raise funds to support six World Vision Area projects that focus on education in Jaipur, Barmer, Kanpur, North-West Delhi, Hardoi and Pauri.
 
A corporate speaker, writer  & social entrepreneur, Samantha is also the first woman and the youngest person ever to complete the ‚Äò4 Deserts Grand Slam‚Äô, one of the toughest endurance events on the planet.
 
Samantha Gash | We appreciate your solid determination, spirit of adventure and your whole-hearted dedication to a noble cause. We wish you continued success in this challenging endeavor.
comments: Nic Nac..if you have some spare time...one way to see India

Please let us win so that she can drag me along to the many activities that bintan has to offer!!!! üòÅ$$I should win this because bringing my wife out to club med bintan is a dream come true. Right or not?Claire Audrey Lim . We can document our trip on her bl..internet diary.. and fulfil our dream in the luxurious resort with just the sand, sun and sea with wifey!$$I really hope to win the stay at club Med Bintan as I wish to bring my mum to this beautiful place and share the joy with her. It's going to be her first time there and Club Med Bintan will definitely create the best memories for her!:)$$We are entering our 10th year of marriage and it'd be both our BIG 4 (40) this year!! It'd be amazing if I can win it especially for my hub who will be celebrating his birthday in June. Our first date holiday was in Club Med Cherating and it was a place n memory to cherish. Hoping to rekindle the feeling.... Now, along with our little one. üòä$$I would like to win this prize as both my kids have never been to Bintan before. My second boy just turned 10. He's mildly autistic and has tactile sensitivity issues including touching the sand. We hope the beautiful setting in Club Med Bintan will be a good place to learn to like the sand, sun and sea more.$$I want to experience the Club Med hospitality! It's all-inclusive type of stay is really one of a kind. With so many activities and F&B options to choose from. Plus exploring the areas outside the resort like the Chinese temple with the 500 statues (must be some story to that!) and the new mall Plaza Lagoi! Let me win please!$$I would love to win as we have never been to Bintan despite living in Singapore five years. Looks like so much more to do than I realised and totally worth the trip after all!$$Kids are amazing but nobody told me I would never sleep properly again! Bintan would be a great battery recharge while exhausting the kiddies at Club Med activities. 
And OMG did u say JETPACKs?!? That's a total dream come true....remember those projects when you are 7 where you draw the imaginary future? Mine was flying around on JETPACKs! I must have been visualising the Bintan holiday I won??? üòò$$I would like to win this trip as Bintan is my first holidays with my husband when the time we married.A lot of memories and we hope to bring our son along to share with him .Club Med fits into the travel Plus Bintan has so much interesting places and the seafood is so shiok.$$I should win this trip because I've always been a huge lover of the beach and the sea. My ideal vacation is one spent by the waters, reading a good book, and occasionally getting up to snorkel or engage in other water sports. What got me the most excited about this post though, is #2, where it mentions a plane ride with an experienced pilot. My boyfriend is an avid flyer (SO avid that he can tell you the exact engine codes once he hears an airplane fly past. No kidding.), and his dream has always been to be a pilot himself. Though he hasn't been able to do so, he loves all things to do with planes and coming on this trip would give us the perfect opportunity to extend our stay and engage this pilot! It'll be a lovely surprise for him :)

http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/dining/dim-sum-guide.htmlLearn how many ways you can enjoy Dim Sum?  Take a look at our Dim sum guide and select from the menu.  Simply print the list of mouth-watering Chinese snacks and take it to your favourite Chinese restaurant for ordering.

Someone suggested Dim Sum at a particular restaurant. Most of us had never eaten there before, although we were all frequent visitors to HK. message+desc:
The Merlion Tower is one place Singaporeans know to avoid. (Poor tourists!) Check out these hilarious reviews by our members!

Steadyhands: "I just couldn't give this place a zero rating. So, it's a 0.5 in lieu of a zero. Sentosa should either open up the Merlion as an observation tower for free or tear it down. And stop charging entry fees! "

Lansell Taudevin: "I love Sentosa. I am aware that the Merlion is a significant icon in Singapore. But the Merlion Tower is at the bottom of the pile of interesting things to do.

What do you do? You pay your money. You watch an introductory video n the mythological origins of the Merlion. (Try and stay awake) You travel to the top. You walk out. You walk around. You look. You go back down. You pass through yet another souvenir shop. You pause. You star back to the top, where you were a few moments ago, and you ask yourself: "What the???"

Sorry, Merle, there are so many more fascinating things to do on Sentosa, and for the $8 admission fee I can buy one and a half ice creams."

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/sg/attractions/5579-the-merlion-tower-sentosaPhotos, Directions & Insider Reviews by Locals - The Merlion Tower and Merlion Walk is an attraction in Sentosa that explores the origins of Singapore's most famous mythological icon.
comments: It's absolutely tragic!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan, Puerto Princesa

What is it?
The series of protruding limestone formations unique to Palawan make the province home to lakes as well. These lakes are formed when water is trapped in the spaces in between the limestone cliffs. 

Fun Fact:
A Palawan getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without limestone cliff diving. The otherworldly rock formations make a picturesque backdrop for jumpshot-off-the-cliff photos.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Jao Bautista

Nathan Cockman Brendan Cockman no more Bali this place next$$Yes it's so amazing places!! God creates!!!$$my country had alot of problem but there is also alot to be seen amazing..$$Highly recommended!! Visiting that place was unbelievable!! More info >> http://bit.ly/1ffWCWwThe ICLEI EcoMobility World Festival and congress teams are getting ready to travel to Suwon to get the show on the road! 

Can we make it to 500 Faceboook likes before the Festival and congress kick off on 1 September? 

Our followers already span across 20 countries and every continent! Help us spread the excitement of EcoMobility World Festival further!

Pearl of the Orient$$Come on Glenn Igor Ellison, tell me you don't want to go there üòÜ$$Mike Acebedo Lopez was live.
about an hour ago ¬∑ 
An Appeal to the United Nations from a former Filipino Delegate to the United Nations General Assembly

I am Michael Francis Acebedo Lopez, a Filipino and a former delegate to the United Nations General Assembly. Nearly ten years before the questionable rise of one Leni Robredo to the Philippine Vice Presidency, I had the honor of representing my country, the Philippines, as the youngest Filipino delegate to the United Nations General Assembly in its history. I also had the opportunity to be the Philippines‚Äôs first actual Youth Representative or Delegate, a partial fulfillment of our commitment to the UN‚Äôs World Programme of Action for Youth or WPAY. 

UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon accepted my letter of credential signed by the Philippine Foreign Minister. There it was stated that I was attending the General Assembly ‚Äúas Adviser to the Third Committee Plenary Session on Social Development, including questions relating to the World Social Situation and to Youth, Ageing, Disabled Persons and the Family.‚Äù In the august halls of the UN World Headquarters in New York, I also had the honor to draft and deliver the Philippine Statement to the General Assembly‚Äôs Third Committee. 

In light of Vice President Robredo‚Äôs video message to the UN Commission on Narcotic Drugs posted on TIME Magazine‚Äôs website and shared by various media organizations, I am recalling the mandate I was once given in an effort to reach out to all of you, member states of the UN and all organizations within the UN System. If said mandate is not sufficient because it has long since lapsed, I am hinging my appeal therefore on my being a natural born citizen of one of only four Asian nations who signed the 1945 Charter that created the United Nations. 

I am making this urgent appeal on behalf of each and every Filipino grossly misrepresented by our a Vice President in said video message, a Vice President whose own mandate has been called into question, with the highest electoral tribunal of the land, the Presidential Electoral Tribunal, having considered the election protest against her win to be sufficient in both form and substance. 

With unfounded claims and unsubstantiated allegations, Vice President Robredo wantonly painted an impossibly grim image of the Philippine situation if only to attract international attention and action. To say that she delved in speculation is understating the gravity of her made-up claims and the severity of the damage she has caused on our country and our people in so doing. In reporting to the world what she failed to report to Philippine authorities, assuming there are actual reports received by the Office of the Vice President, she has not only embarrassed our country, she has betrayed the public trust and committed economic sabotage, both punishable under Philippine laws. 

For her to say that ‚Äúour people feel both hopeless and helpless‚Äù is a brazen lie. Confidence in the presidency is at an all time high (while the same cannot be said of the vice president whose approval ratings continue to plummet); as a people, we feel hopeful and empowered like we‚Äôve never felt before. 

Please understand that at the heart of this is destructive party politics. It is the Vice President‚Äôs party flexing its muscles to overthrow a duly elected government so they may once more regain control of government. Perhaps she feels time is running out for her because of developments in the Presidential Electoral Tribunal. So she and her allies have launched an expensive campaign using human rights and the War on Drugs as their excuse to bait the world into interfering in our domestic issues. 

When the Vice President says 7,000 people have been killed in the President‚Äôs War on Drugs, she fails to mention that this is set against the backdrop of around 700,000 to one million successful arrests and surrenders. So the figure she presents to you is not even one percent. And surely with the sheer number of those involved in the illicit drug trade, some police operations see suspects resisting arrest and fighting back and the police having to defend themselves resulting in casualties. Every war has casualties. It is not a perfect war and I‚Äôm certain there have been abuses along the way, and these need to be looked into and those responsible must be brought to justice. But exaggerating things does not help at all. 

In asking for the international community, the UN, to intervene, she uses the issue of human rights. Let us then talk about human rights. 

In responding to the call of Robredo, the international community must tread carefully lest it encroaches on our very sovereignty and our right to self-determination. And as a sovereign state, we have determined to wage an internal war (not a war against another nation) against the evils of drugs, a direction affirmed by our democratic processes when President Duterte who included the War on Drugs as one of his main programs of action, received an overwhelming mandate during the May 2016 Presidential Election. In short, the War on Drugs, by extension, has the people‚Äôs mandate. 

Any effort to disturb our democracy and sovereignty as a response to the Vice President‚Äôs irresponsible and unfounded claims will subvert the will of the Filipino people and violate our Human Right of Suffrage enshrined in both the Philippine Constitution and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (Article 21 of the international covenant). 

Once again, I am making this appeal to all member states of the United Nations and all organizations within the UN System to disregard the Philippine Vice President‚Äôs statement which is, I reiterate, a grave misrepresentation of the prevailing sentiments of our people and a gross perversion of the facts surrounding the War on Drugs. 

To my fellow Filipinos, let us remain vigilant in the face of threats to our democracy by the very people who claim to defend it. Ako po‚Äôy nanawagan na i-share ang video na ito upang ito ay umabot sa UN at sa iba‚Äôt ibang foreign governments. 

Maraming salamat. Thank you and good evening.

message+desc:
A Filipina is 2016 Asia's Best Female Chef. Congratulations, Margarita Fores!

LUSSO by Margarita For√©s  Cibo  Alta at Ascott BGCAsia‚Äôs 50 Best Restaurants, sponsored by S.Pellegrino & Acqua Panna, is owned and run by William Reed Business Media, the same organisation behind The World's 50 Best Restaurants and Latin America‚Äôs 50 Best Restaurants. The list is created from the votes of 300-plus industry experts across Asia.
comments:
I would gladly visit her restaurant during my next visit. Overall filipino cuisine, when trying to imitate European or American tastes, has left me greatly disappointed. Plus: While most ordinary filipinos are warm and welcoming, in restaurants they seem to not have a clue about hospitality. This accounts especially for touristy areas, where you will often find lacklustre Italians or even German restaurants (most of them owned by italians or germans who clearly have no passion at all). Filipino cuisine, unlike most pundits will tell you, does not have to hide from other cuisines at all. You can get absolutely delicious dishes, for example in Restaurants in Makati. Simple Lang - Ayala Triangle was the best Restaurant i visited during my last trip. So please do not try to imitate Italians in a sad way, stick to your own cuisine and be proud of it - you surely can!$$My wife and I had the pleasure to taste Gaita's famed cooking when she came to visit Edinburgh and was invited as an honoured guest of Kuya Greg and sister Isabel Fernandez of Lyncliff Hotel. What an unforgettable experience. Congratulations Margarita Fores.$$The Best Chef is who share the best recipes üòÄüçúüçóüç¢$$Congratulations !!!
Great News for The Best Chef . Good Luck & God Bless .$$It's just proves.... From Meik$$Congrats !  Another Pinay to be proud of ! Yeaay...$$AMAZING!! Congratulations to her :)

message+desc:
Who's up for some island hopping?

You've come to the right place, they said. After 36 hours of travel, we awoke to the brilliant yellows of sunrise reaching over, what seemed to be, infinite waters. We threw on our bathing suits, lathered on the sun lotion, and jumped on a boat set for the islands off of Palawan.

From what I gathered from past tropical destinations, I half-expected these islands to be bustling with tourists. Dropping anchor here was a stunning surprise, setting our sights on the surroundings with not another person in sight. We scrambled for the snorkel gear, and dove into the blue to witness the vibrant coral and sea life. Day one on our adventure, and already one I won't forget.

Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn
comments: Reminds me of the beautiful waters sailing round the Greek islands. Somewhere you can be at peace and in balance with nature$$On your way to/from San Vicente, come relax and reconnect with nature at Puerto Beach Resort, www.puertobeachresort.com ; kilometer 66 northbound, Concepcion, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan, Philippones !$$Andra same town where Port Barton is located.$$Its not a paradise and cant be compared to.... Nice view from top level$$Christiane Tornapunta best memories, need to catch up soon!!$$Danica Mogus this is where we going üòç$$Been there last year and Port Barton as well.$$Is this the port barton?$$Thanks for maria she bring me her$$So gorgeous!Is it safe here?üòÉüòÉ$$Ashlee we need to go here so i can show you around$$stunning! www.missearthnews.blogspot.com

message+desc:
Where is it?
Pamilacan, Bohol

What is it?
A great dive spot, Pamilacan is also known for its white sand beaches and dolphin and whale-watching tours.

Fun fact:
Life in Pamilacan Island is simple, with electricity only running for a few hours each night. Once it gets dark, get ready for a dazzling view of the starlit sky. If you're lucky, you might even see some comets!

Photo by Mick Harris

message+desc:
[New] 5 Reasons Why Invisalign Is The New Braces Of The 21st Century

Invisalign is the dental treatment that eliminates all the problems associated with traditional braces - you feel less pain, have fewer trips to the dentist, and it can be $1,000-$2,000 cheaper than braces at this clinic!

PS if you're interested in learning more, there's a free Open Day on 26 November at Camden Medical Centre where you find out more from Dr. Catherine Lee Orthodontics - Singapore/Kuala Lumpur!

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/invisalignForget about looking like an awkward teenager. With Invisalign, you can get straight teeth painlessly and no one will be able to tell!
comments: Well a pair of those braces cost abt 5k... ouch$$WHERE?!?! I always tot invisalign are like 10k üòáüòá$$just to mention as someone who has done invisalign and also a bit nosy - life is not "as back to normal" as you'd want. you'd have to put on the braces for 22hours for optimum effect (that's 2 hours left to eat - esp when you're the kind who likes to eat out with your friends), you speak weird, and for me it was the start of flossing everyday (i had to sand my tooth so as to widen the gaps for my front teeth to move, luckily i didn't have to extract any more than my wisdom teeth so that's a plus!). i still get food stuck in the gaps every day so it's a pain eating leafy veggie and beef brisket. also if you don't have the habit of brushing after every meal you might get cavities :^) i've done braces before tho and i think the fact that you don't get your tongue pierced by the wire is wonderful. invisalign also helped sharpen my jaw!$$XiaoZyenh Tan this I mentioned$$Queenie Kok Jiahui i thought they cost like 10k sia

message+desc:
On June 12, 1898, General Emilio Aguinaldo proclaimed the Philippines‚Äô independence from Spain‚Äôs rule from the window of his house in Kawit, Cavite. This year, the historic Aguinaldo Shrine will feature video mapping projections recounting the story of our nation‚Äôs independence. Drop by the Aguinaldo Shrine grounds from today until June 15, anytime between 7:30 pm to 10:30 pm, and watch history come alive in a new light.  

Don‚Äôt forget to capture photos and videos of the monumental display of lights and sounds, to showcase that even Independence Day celebrations are more fun in the Philippines! #FilipinoShines

message+desc: Good morning! If you happen to be in Seoul today, stop by our Tourist Information Center at KTO headquarters for an awesome exhibit featuring K-pop stars promoting Korean tourism. AND - rumor has it that the TIC will be receiving a very special guest...at 10:30 KST this morning! Hope to see you there!Korean Tourism Promotion Exhibition with Stars of Hallyu, the Korean Wave
comments:
miss A! We will have pictures from the event posted in a few hours!$$how i wish i was there!!$$Who was the special guest? :D Any special guests for the end of the week? I'll be in Seoul! :)$$Hi Melinda! The exhibit runs until December 25th, but right now we don't think there will be any more K-pop stars making appearances. We'll let you know if anything changes, though!$$Winter in Korea occurred in the month of December to early March, now to enjoy the winter in Korea are some pretty interesting places to visit by us. Nami Island or also called Naminara Republic. Located in Bangha-ri, Namsan-myeon, Chuncheon-si originally not an island. This is the island Bukhangang River, which was made as a result of dam construction Cheongpyeong. Circumference is about 6km, and the area is 430,000. There grassplot than 260,000 in the middle of the island. Nami Island is a beautiful and interesting island to visit with family, friends or spouse during the spring and winter. Because in addition to having natural beauty, Nami itself has a sweet romance and memories when we visit there. And that is strengthened by the story of a love story of the drama 'winter sonata'.

You must already know the story korean drama "Winter Sonata" which players Bae Yong-jun, Choi Ji-woo and alm. Park Yong-Ha. Winter Sonata is a love story that is able to anesthetize the audience. The story of this drama is about love first has enormous power. Power is capable of uniting the two lovebirds even though many things have become hindrance of their relationship. Almost certainly you'll like the 2002 series is made in Korea. Besides interwoven stories that are packed very beautiful, background paronama winter is very captivating to watch. Nami Island in the drama is created, so Nami Island became world famous.

In addition to Nami Island, Winter in the city of Seoul is also quite interesting to enjoy. Because along the sidewalk in the winter, many vendors sell snacks winter is quite popular as roasted sweet potatoes, roasted chestnut, hoppang kind of steamed bread, and bungeo-ppang fish-shaped bread that is in filled with red bean paste. Although Korea has grown rapidly and is more modern, but traditional snacks are still there and not change and can bring us back to childhood for the ancient Korean society. Winter in Korea is very cold, windy and dry, so this is a nightmare for our skin. Do not forget when you come to Korea during the winter always apply moisturizer to the skin that are not easily dry and wrinkled. Hehehe ......

If a vacation in the winter, not afdol if not try the game skating on the ice at the Everland amusement park is popular in winter. Skiing and snowboarding are the most exciting games in the winter, because it's a lot of visitors who arrive in this Everland. In winter there are also several festivals are held to enliven the winter, like Taebaeksan Snow Festival. This festival is one of the most interesting festivals in the country and popular Korean ginseng and this wave. In addition, tourists can also enjoy a visit there and follow the race to form snow with a gift that was quite interesting. Kite festival in the winter is also quite interesting in Korea. Not to mention the concerts are held in this season, which presents K-pop that has been popular in the world, such as Super Junior, Shinee, Fx, SNSD, Beast, TVQX, Wonder Girl, Big Bang, 2NE1, T-ARA and other other. Well, how do you want to try a visit to the State which will terkanal ginseng, natural beauty, culture, and his K-POP in this winter ??.....C'mon guys visit in the korean.
The ski travel program includes daytime activities such as ski instruction, amateur ski competitions, snowboard competitions, and sledding competitions, while featuring some nighttime events like Korea traditional dance and modern performances. There are also a number of additional special events, discounts and free gifts for visitors.
In the recent years, the number of Southeast Asian tourists for the winter season has increased because of the snow covered mountains and the fun and thrills that are offered at the ski resorts in Korea.

http://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=2297430562255&set=o.290295891015878&type=1&theater
Please "like" my story$$Thank you, I will visit the exhibit anyway! Thanks and see you in a few days... :)

message+desc:
Take it from this Swede who has lived in both countries.Some may wish they could leave Singapore and live in a place like, say, Sweden.

But is Sweden really better than Singapore? This Swedish guy made 2 videos to say: NO.

https://mustsharenews.com/singapore-sweden-videos/
comments:
I think Singaporeans take housing for granted the most. Across the world, house ownership is a pipe dream for an entire generation of millennials. Not to say housing in SG is perfect, but at least it's attainable.$$Having to visit Stockholm a month ago, I tend to agree that SG is better than Sweden (while I do like their architecture). Their cabs are insane, no regulations and touting for business and ridiculously priced. The licensed one that I took cost me S$80 from airport to city and the drive said unlicensed ones can cost up to S$200... Unlike other Scandinavian countries, people there don't seem to be as friendly or happier... Food and transport were also more expensive than Denmark and Finland, even public areas are dirtier than their 2 counterparts. So yeah, I'll pick SG anytime over Sweden$$Why bother to compare and say which is better? There will always be things that are better on 1 side but there will also be things that are worse. It's like when you are in school and got 89 marks for your test. And then your mom comes and say why u no like the other kid who got 92 marks and ignoring the fact that your 89 mark is actually the second highest, better than the other 30 kids in the class. Sigh....$$Be contented with what you have. Singaporeans complain too much. If singapore was so bad then please give up your space to someone who will appreciate it more.$$The grass is always greener on the other side, there's no perfect system of governance, just a better balance of left and right...$$Singapore is great if you can afford to uber everywhere like the  Swedish guy,  or afford private housing which that guy seems to ('much more attractive option anyway' or something like that)$$Sure you wanna compare?
... Singapore government taxes us More than 300 over percent for buying just a car, and that's exclude the earnings our local car dealers are profiting in the process$$Malaysia even much better than both countries provided you are not align to any politics here . Expatriates with their salaries have a wonderful life here.$$I think he forgot to compare salary vs living cost to yield expendable income, it is not fair to compare just area vs area without comparing the above. For vandalism and subway, I agree that SG is way better than any other country (except HK :P) due to absolute strict law. No cigarette butt due to strict law again. Glass door on subway station and the safety cone on construction area / road is for safety and to avoid subway company and government bodies being sued by passenger accident. While due to strict law, order is there always. This area Singapore always better than any other country in the world.$$Rubbish article. In SG, most of the time you do not own the property but rent it for 99 years.  And that is full rental payment up front upon signing the "ownership" lease.

Transport is easy becos we are a small city.  MRT?  Rofl!  Really?  Dun think all our MRTs have screen doors.  All of them started WITHOUT screen doors and we had our share of people being pushed or fell onto the tracks.

He should really do more research before posting this fake news.$$Might as well compare our houses to mansion houses and say we are deplorables? 

This goalpost changing where everyone has their own criteria is annoying.

Everyone wants the MRT to be better. Like common$$I have also lived in both countries and this article is so biased it is not even funny$$Cos they are treated special here with the Asians kowtowing to them??..Back, in Sweden, they are just common White..üòÇ$$Try stealing a chair in singapore lor... you can go jail and get fine... lol singapore so small where you gonna run ? And why would Singaporean wanna steal a chair that's worth $50-$100 when the fine is $2000 and get jailed... probably because Singaporean will think of consequences first before acting.$$He just tasting the icying on the cake.. wait till he gets the whole cake and see if Singapore is still sweet...$$Singaporeans take things for granted. Only if they have lived abroad for a few years will they then know its Great To Be Home (SINGAPORE). i HOPE THIS VIDEO BY STEFAN WAKES SINGAPOREANS UP ESPECIALLY THE YOUNG ONES.$$Housing and transport. SG is only better if you have 3 to 4 times more cash than the middle class folks in these countries. And sg weather is hot and humid uncomfortable!$$The girls in Sweden are hotter. Nothing to do with this article but a valid point for choosing Sweden.$$Because you are not Singapore citizen, yet.$$Most singaporean ÁîüÂú®Á¶è‰∏≠Ôºå‰∏çÁü•Á¶èÔºÅJust know how to complain and expect things to be in their 'perfect' way!$$That's show how FTs are not welcome to theirs country....so stop dreaming.$$I just read the comments and again I'm reminded that people only hear/see what they want. Sigh...$$The cool climate are already 5 points up above SG as what I think$$Sometimes... people need to be kicked out of their own country to know how good it is... with or without it.$$Litmus test. Ask him if he wants to be a Singaporean citizen.

Where is it? 
Batanes, Luzon

What is it like? 
Biking is the ideal way to get a feel for Batanes, with its rolling hills and friendly locals. Around here, it's all about the experience of getting lost.

How to get there: 
Fly into Batanes from Manila, Cagayan or Ilocos Norte.

Fun Fact: 
Batanes is the smallest province in the Philippines, both in terms of population and land area.

Photo by/Author: 
Teddy Pelaez/Magnus Ahmad

message+desc:
Where is it?
Anawangin, Zambales

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Zambales from Caloocan or Cubao.

What is it?
Views don't get much better than rocky mountains overlooking a forest of pine trees fringing soft volcanic-sand shores. Anawangin Cove is stunningly beautiful. And it's open to campers. All the better to enjoy the swimming, trekking and rock-climbing on offer.

Fun Fact:
A freshwater bath in Anawangin Cove requires the use of a tabo ‚Äì a plastic dipper that you use to scoop water out of a pail, and pour water over your head.

Kahit weekend lang. Catherine Rose Ramos Joey Indrinal Tin Naval$$Great place! We really enjoyed this!$$Ray Recaido you know where it is right? üòä

1. Like us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter 
2. Upload a photo on FB, IG, or Twitter showing why Metro Manila is the Capital of Fun. Tag us with your photos in any of our accounts using the #CapitalofFun as hashtag
3. The most liked photo in each applicable social media platform shall get 1 VIP ticket and 3 Gen.Ad tickets for MTV Music Evolution 2016
4.There will be no limit as to the number of entries and everyone can upload their photos using all applicable social media accounts
5. Deadline of entries will be on 11pm of  21 June 2016
6. Winners will be declared in all our social media accounts on 22 June 2016
7. In addition to the prizes for the most liked photo, consolation prizes and 2 Gen.Ad tickets will be given to the 2nd and 3rd most liked photos in all applicable social media platforms

Send your entries now and get a chance to watch #OneRepublic #APink #JaDine and many more live!

#MTVmusicevo #CapitalofFun #VisitPhilippinesAgain2016 #ItsMoreFunInThePhilippines

message+desc:
If you missed Sakura but still want to see them, how about travel north?
Photo of the day is Hirosaki Castle, Aomori prefecture.
2,600 cherry trees are planted around the castle, and the festival is held until May 6th. According to Sakura forecast, full bloom will be May 3rd.
Hirosaki is lovely castle town, and it‚Äôs wonderful place to enjoy Sakura!
Destination guide;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/aomori/hirosaki.html
comments: Tks your advice.  Looking forward visiting there next week!!!$$Hirosaki is, indeed, a lovely castle town and a perfect backdrop for the wonderful cherry blossom. Also worth seeing in Hirosaki is Fujita Memorial Japanese garden.$$Saw this Hirosaki Castle on Korean Drama of KBS The Innocent Man.$$Plan NOW to see Japan in AUTUMN www.toursgallery.com as October and November tours available.

message+desc:
If you are planning to come to Japan in June to early July, why not try high qualities Sato Nishiki cherry! This is a juicy cherry with plenty of nectar and a good balance of sweetness and tartness. You can see packs at fruit shops and supermarkets  or even you can go cherry picking! It's an early summer special. Don't miss it!
Related info.:http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/dining/food/jfood_11.html

message+desc:
‚ÄúOtsukimi‚Äù or ‚ÄúTsukimi‚Äù, literally meaning moon-viewing is a Japanese custom honoring the full moon in the mid-September. 
The traditions include displaying Japanese pampas grass and eating rice dumplings called ‚ÄúTsukimi-dango‚Äù.
Enjoy viewing the beautiful full moon and Japanese tradition in the long autumn evenings!

Visit our website and find out more about cultural customs in Japan
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/ab.html

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Coron, Palawan

What is it like? 
The wrecks of a World War II Japanese supply fleet are the main attraction for most divers in Coron. The ships have long since become part of the surrounding marine habitat. They're even home to scores of corals and fish.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

Fun Fact: 
The ten wreck sites have something for everyone's tastes. They were even listed in Forbes Traveler Magazine's "Top 10 Best Dive Sites in the World."

Photo by/Author: 
Adrien Uichico/Magnus Ahmad

message+desc:
Have you ever visited Japanese traditional garden?
KENROKUEN in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Pref. is known as one of the three most beautiful gardens in Japan and it was open to the public in 1874. Early summer, we can enjoy to seeing a lot of colorful flower such as Japanese Iris, Azalea, hydrangea etc.
There are so many beautiful gardens all over Japan where you can feel traditional atmosphere besides the nature. 
Let‚Äôs go exploring Japanese Gardens before it gets hot summer ;)
Kenrokuen Garden> 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/gardens/kenrokuen.html
http://www.pref.ishikawa.jp/siro-niwa/kenrokuen/e/history.html
Japanese Gardens >
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/category/index.html?cat=gardens
[PDF] > http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/rtg/pdf/pg-808.pdf

message+desc:
Where is it?
Banaue Rice Terraces, Ifugao

How To Get There:
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc. 

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue.

What Is It?
These 2,000 year old rice terraces were carved into the mountains of Ifugao by ancestors of the indigenous people.

Fun Fact:
This UNESCO World Heritage Site is still in use today.

Photo by  / Headline by:
Daniel Carpentier  / Cecile Golez
comments: Take good care of our nature so that nature will take good carevof us too.$$thank you God for your creations..thank you for the wonderful philippines! world of wonders tlaga ang pilipinas!$$Im proud to be an ifugao and proud of my native home :) visit us here in banaue and see our very own rice terraces and wonderful waterfall :)$$The rice terraces w/c always features in most pictures and films was not in banaue but in batad. Banaue is a town and batad is a village. From banaue, u have to ride a jeep to saddle and walk about 4hrs to get in batad. Good thing the roads were now cemented unlike before, no jeep can go to saddle so u have to walk/hike for 6 hrs or more. Haha! Good luck to those who will visit our place. Enjoy :)$$it is more convenient travelling to banaue from manila, what happened to suspension of gv florida bus...$$Great location and beautiful scenery. Lovely traditions. üì∑üöåüöó$$really beautiful..one of the great destination in the philippines.proud ever...$$Really very sweet & beautyful nature I like this...$$Was once on the 7 wonders of the world..$$Philippines! I love for being a real Filipino!$$Yup its so wonderful place and this is my new provnce $$Everything is More fun in the PHILIPPINES$$How can someone forget a landscape like that?! Can't wait to go back there!$$we tripped there last week

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bangui, Ilocos 

How to Get There:
Fly from Taiwan or Manila to Laoag.

Or take a bus from Cubao or Pasay to Laoag.

What is it?
Just outside the municipality of Pagudpud, along the coast of Bangui bay, you‚Äôll see a row of huge windmills measuring 23-storeys high. These giant electric fans help provide up to 40% of electricity to Ilocos Norte. 

Fun Fact:
To see another towering spectacle, you can make a quick drive to Burgos, Ilocos Norte to see the Cape Bojeador Lighthouse. 

Photo by / Headline by:
Grace Consolacion / Brandon Dollente
comments: I lived in Cubao for 4 years.$$Pass that way each time I travel to Loaog & Aparri.$$Our country is beautiful... full of the prettiest culture, customs and traditions. Visit us...$$I wish I could go there.$$Been there for the nth time...hehehe..,hubby's town.. just a few meters away from their home..$$maganda sa place Bangui love the wind turbines god bless the Philippines !!$$We been there a summer trip fr vigan to ilocus norte wonderful...$$huh ,, is that safe for wildlife?$$Its so cool there u can feel the wind blows been there for a tour..

Beautiful colonial bungalows that were previously a part of Seletar Airbase have been converted into a collection of hipster cafes turning this area into a cool new hangout spot. Be warned that prices are not cheap and this is not the easiest to acess if you don't drive. That's part of the exclusivity of this place.

message+desc:
Matcha is the tea used in "Sado", the traditional Japanese tea ceremony.  
It is made of dried green tea leaves that have been ground into a fine powder. This powder is then dissolved in hot water and stirred thoroughly, making a delicious foam on top. Matcha is also used in traditional Japanese confections and various savory dishes!

Learn more:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/f.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/hj/matcha.html
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1605_teaceremony.html
comments:
As a matcha student and vendor, allow me to make 2 suggested changes to your post:
1) matcha does not dissolve, it remains in suspension, 2) matcha needs to be whipped, not stirred).
Www.chajin-online.com

message+desc:
23 Words Mispronounced By Singaporeans Their Whole Lives

Is flour pronounced "flahr" or "flo-wer"? It doesn't matter. You will deny it when you know the real answer.

Here are 23 words Singaporeans have been mispronouncing all their lives. 

99.9% of Singaporeans mispronounce #9.

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/words-singaporeans-mispronounceIs flour pronounced flahr or flower? Here are 23 words Singaporeans have been mispronouncing all their lives. 99.9% of Singaporeans mispronounce #9.
comments:
There's also croissant and almond. Don't mind if Singaporeans mispronounce as long they don't try to correct me when I'm pronouncing it correctly. I have come across native British speakers mispronouncing certain words like how Americans mispronounce and now passed into general acceptance. English is much more practical than it used to.$$Vegetable is vejtable :) lol, it took a while to get familiar with all the proper pronunciation. After living oversea for years, enough embarrassment while communicating with foreigners,  I have put in huge effort to drop most of the mis pronunciation. No more Singlish , no more manglish :)$$Another word would be library is often pronounced as "lai-bree" instead of "lai-bray-ree$$"Christian" and "Christianity".$$A word is only mispronounced when the people u are trying to communicate with cannot understand it... Try asking for "flower"  instead of "flah" in our supermarket... 

So American pronunciation and Queens English...  which is right? 

This article makes me uneasy becos its undermining our Singaporean and singlish culture which is unique to us...

We don mispronounce... we just do it differently...$$I'm not sure if those on local media still pronounce Ears as Years, as they used to when I was a consumer.$$You have to add 'liaise'!$$Keep hearing the word "prestigious" being mispronounced on tv and radio here ALL the time.

message+desc:
Today is #ipchun (ÏûÖÏ∂ò)! Ipchun is one of the twenty-four solar terms that marks coming of üå±springüå± according to the lunar calendar! In the past, it was a custom to post papers with words that bear wishes of good luck and abundance on the main door or pillars on ipchun day as people greeted spring into the year. 
If you happen to be on a #VisitKorea trip this time of the year, take a closer look, especially at #Hanok_Villages and you might find doors with writings just like in the photo. Take a photoüì∑ if you find one and let us know where you found it in the comments below!üëá
comments:
Yup... saw this at Bukchon (ÂåóÊùëÔºâ
Of course, we understand the good meanings behind the couplets. However, out of curiosity, why's the paper used white and not red. Is white an auspicious colour in Korea? Appreciate your kind insights on the matter.

For us in Singapore, Ipchun (Á´ãÊò• - Li Chun) likewise, signifies the start of Spring. What happens on this day is indicative of ones wellbeing for the rest of the year.... Therefore banking money into ones bank account signifies (hopefully) abundance and wealth.

Just some cross-cultural sharing! 
„äóÔ∏è Happy Ipchun!! üå∏$$Found this at namsangol hanok village! And I took a pic there too!

Boracay, Aklan

What is it?
The waters of White Beach in Boracay are great for skimboarding because of their gentle waves.

How to get there? 
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

Fun Fact: 
Skimboarding was invented in California, when lifeguards needed a way to get across the beach quickly.

Donald Tapan/Meggy de Guzman

message+desc: Howrah Railway Station is the oldest railway station and the largest railway complex in India. With 23 platforms, it is one of the busiest railway stations in the country in terms of passenger volume per day. The #Howrah railway station also has the distinction of being the railway station with the highest train-handling capacity.
comments: Howrah railway station (HWH) in West Bengal, India is the largest railway station in all of South Asia by area! It daily handles the largest number of trains than any railway station in the Indian subcontinent! Having 23 platforms in all, the highest in South Asia, it possesses one of the most complex and massive route relay interlocking systems. Mail, Express, Passenger, MEMU, DEMU and Kolkata suburban railway commuter trains (EMU trains) throng the railway station very frequently. Passenger density, train density and track density is one if the highest in the country. The railway station is operated both by Eastern Railway (Howrah Division) and South Eastern Railway (Kharagpur Division) of Indian Railways, the 3rd largest passenger railway network in the world! The OHE of the railway station is fully AC electrified.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Ifugao, Luzon

What is it like? 
According to the Cordillera myth, the Ifugao people were created from Wigan, the god of Skyworld. Legend has it that Wigan gave the rice-terrace farming Ifugaos the first sacred rice. It's believed to be of the ipugo (rice of god) variety, which amazingly still flourishes despite certain the harsh conditions of the mountain ranges.

Fun Fact: 
There are more than 20 different cultural dances in this region alone. Each dance is specifically used to celebrate a family occasion or community milestone.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Jao Bautista

History chanel's ancient alien should know bout this legend..hmm$$I love Ifugao n I've been going up there for 39yrs n I've never got tired of it. I always relish n enjoy each time I go up there !!! : )$$Beautiful scenery can be seen here.$$The eighth wonder of the world!$$Our country is very blessed ! The diverse culture of beautiful people are rich in folklores and legends! that gives a feeling of fascination.$$Sender: Jeffrey Solomon 
Photographer: Myselfüòä
Location: Banaue Rice Terraces
All along I was thinking that it is enough to see the rice terraces in post cards but I've proven I was wrong. The Manila-Baguio-Sagada-Banaue route took me a total of 15 hours but it was all worth it after witnessing this breathtaking scenery with our Igorot friends. The journey was great, the destination? Even better!!! This declared Heritage site by UNESCO is a Must visit...  #ItsMoreFunInThePhilippines$$Long live the son of god$$This place is amazing .. Go over to the next Bally and you can see where the hand of god is .. Love this place$$I have a photo with these ladies, too!! It was taken in 2006! Hope this photo is a recent one. Cute!!!!$$Welcome to Banaue Ifugao were you can find the most exciting places like the sceneries of the terraces-the stairway to the sky-the blacksmiths for your tailored jewelries and other views. The friendly people and the likes.$$Yes ! Its top of my list  to go there soon in my next holiday. Bye Berlin ...Hello.! Philippines..$$I hiked just recently on Sept. 5, 2014 accompanied by my tourist guide Rachel Humiwat, we started at Viewpoint and end on the Public Market for nearly 5 hours. The terraces is an engineering marvel and incredible as ever at any time of the year!$$mooie foto's willy xxx vr allen.

message+desc:
One of our staff members went to Oshino Hakkai in Yamanashi Pref. this weekend. The weather was perfect to enjoy Mt. Fuji!
Oshino Hakkai is the name given to the 8 ponds filled with melted snow water that has taken long time to filter through the underground layers of Mt. Fuji.
The nearby museum (Shiryokan) was a great find, not so crowded and could take the best shot of Mt. Fuji and old houses like this picture!
More information about the area:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/scenic/mtfuji/fuji_03.html

message+desc:
The Cordilleras are home to some of the most beautiful rice terraces in the world, and a few of them are inscribed in the UNESCO world heritage list. Here is the race terraces of Bangaan, roughly 1.5hrs away from Banaue town proper. Some of the houses have started to use modern materials but still visible are the native wooden huts that were built without the use of nails.

Words and Photo by @tugaff

terraces in the world.$$Can't wait to go back here!!! Taylor Tyler

Kurashiki City(Okayama Pref.)
 Kurashiki City is leading industrial district historically, and well-known for the lovely, white white walls of the buildings.
The stream is ruuning down the street, its scenery is so stunning!  And also there are many shops such as variety stores, a museum, cafes on the streets. Kurashiki is only about 20 minutes train ride from Okayama station.

message+desc:
Seomun Market is one of the best places on Jeju Island to experience the culture, life and laughter of the island's people. The small alleyways of stallholders have sold their wares for decades to loyal customers and tourists wanting to feel Jeju's unique community vibrancy.

message+desc:
The massive rock at Chadayamangalam, #Kerala, derives its name from the mythical bird Jatayu in the epic Ramayana. The bird is believed to have fallen on the rock after he failed in his efforts to prevent the kidnapping of Sita by Ravana. 

A nature park project named Jatayu Nature Park has been started with the objective of promoting adventure, mythology and wellness tourism. The park covers over 65 acres of land and hosts a giant sculpture of Jatayu. Regarded as the world‚Äôs largest bird sculpture, it will house a 6D theatre and an audio-visual based digital museum that will give the visitors interesting glimpses of the Ramayana. 

This enchanting sculpture will surely woo the world.
comments: Super effort, it gives an idea abt Ramayana for the next generation.$$Still not finished the work.$$I have seen documentary on this. Once completed it would be an awesome piece of work. The 6d would be too good$$Is it completed.. Is this place good for an outing now??

message+desc:
Ranakpur, a quaint village situated in the Aravalli mountain ranges in the Pali district of Rajasthan, is home to one of the biggest and most significant Jain temple complexes in India. 

The temple comprises 29 halls, 80 domes and 1444 unique marble pillars, each of them intricately carved, yet no two are alike.The main temple, the Adinath or Chaumukha temple (the four-faced temple), is dedicated to the first Tirthankara, Adinath.

#Jainism #Pali #Rajasthan #IncredibleIndia
comments: have been there....amazing place$$An incredible place! Well worth seeing.

message+desc: Located within Pang Ali-ali Village, Banggae sub district, Majene Regency,in the province of West Sulawesi, this where the ancestors of the ancient Banggae Kingdom of Majene found their final resting place. Many suggest that the hilltop location was chosen with a reason so that these ancestors can watch over their descendents below and when they sail away to make their living in the open seas. http://goo.gl/kbGIAK #WonderfulIndonesiaLocated on the Ondongan Hill overlooking the beautiful Bay of Majene,West Sulawesi, the ancestors of the Mandar ethnic group in the Banggae Kingdom of Majene could not have picked a better place to bury their Kings and royal families than at this Royal Cemetery of Banggae Kings and Hadat.
comments: I wonder, did the west Papuan people that Indonesia murdered and still murdering get a place to rest?

message+desc:
Have you ever been to Dagashi-ya? 
Dagashi-yaÔºàÈßÑËèìÂ≠êÂ±ãÔºâ is a traditional candy store that sells cheap sweets and snacks (and sometimes toys), and is loved by all generations. The number of Dagashi-ya has declined in towns so people reminisce about their childhood when they find it. The one in this picture is a reproduction of a nostargic Dagashi-ya that can be seen in shopping malls, and people were looking around like they forget time passing.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Siargao, Surigao del Norte

What is it like? 
The Philippines isn‚Äôt a major surf destination yet. That means more waves for you. We recommend hitting the beaches of Siargao, the country's surfing capital. Its popular surfing points have interesting names: Jack Horse, Quiksilver and the famous Cloud 9 ‚Äî known for its thick, perfect hollow tubes. It‚Äôs only been a few decades since American surf enthusiasts brought their boards to the Philippines, but our beaches have really taken to surf culture. As they should. They‚Äôve got water and waves to spare.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Surigao (one hour), then take a boat to Siargao.

Or take a bus from Manila or Davao to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao.

Or take a boat from Manila to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao.

Fun Fact: 
International surfers call Cloud 9's perfect tubes as "the special wave." The wave was discovered by traveling surfers in the late 1980s. It was named and made famous by American photographer John S. Callahan.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga
comments: I need to go back there it's beautiful..when is the best surf season Habagat or Amihan ?$$I've been in siargao cloud 9 way back 1999..but I'll be visiting my beloved country Philippines this year..see you soon!God willing..$$I guess l gotta check this place out. The last time I was there my driver would only take me to San Juan on the south china  sea side of the Philippines$$I want to get there so very badly

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Boracay Island, Aklan

What is it like?
With all the water activities it offers, Boracay is one action-packed island. But that doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt find your spot of tranquility. Visit Station 1 for quieter accommodations.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

Fun Fact: 
The powdery white sand and the pristine waters aren‚Äôt the only things to enjoy in Boracay. There are also golf courses on offer.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department of the Philippines/Brandon Dollente
comments: I love that place, maybe I will live there one day :)$$Taken a few years ago in Boracay. I stayed at the Shangi-La in a two room villa. One of my best vacations.$$Boracay is still No1 for me! After 20 years and I think about 100 trips from Caticlan to Boracay during our time on Panay Island I'm still unhappy to leave Boracay! I think you can find all kind of relaxing and fun on this island and for all kind of budget.$$Missing the empty shores of Boracay from yesteryears like this photo. message+desc:
Nagasaki Lantern Festival is being held at Chinatown in Nagasaki City till Feb. 14th. Nagasaki is located at the western edge of Kyushu and it has made this city international as the center site of the trade with other countries since 15th century. 
 During the festival, you can enjoy about 15,000 colorful lanterns illuminating the city as well as the events as traditional Chinese dancing or parades. Why don‚Äôt you go and feel the fantastic atmosphere?
¬©Nagasaki Kanko Remei

Destination guide:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/nagasaki/teramachi.html

That's awesome$$Amazing city! I loved it when I was there. During the festival it must be so great!

message+desc:
Gwalior - Legend has it that Gwalior was founded in 8th century AD by a chieftain known as Suraj Sen or Surya Sen of Kachwaha Rajput clan who,when struck by a deadly disease, was curd by a hermit-saint Gwalipa. As a mark of respect to the saint, he built the city of Gwalior after the name of the saint. 

Steeped in its past splendor it was ruled by several dynasties including the Pratiharas, Kachwahas and Tomars who have left imprints of their rule, in this city of outstanding palaces, sacred temples and glorious monuments. It is also the birthplace of great musician Tansen. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/en/travel/destination/gwalior
comments: Gwalior is also famous for ancient Gurdwara @ fort "Data Bandi Chod " from there Sikh community started celebrating  Deepawali. Rani of Jhasi "Lakshmi Bai" left her last breath in gwalior & jumped with his son from the fort of Gwalior.

message+desc:
Cape Kri is one of popular dive sites in Raja Ampat. There is a good chance to spot giant groupers and huge school of fish. The coral formations are impressive and extremely diverse. In the shallows, there are nudibranches and different kind of scorpion fish. 
"On my last trip to Raja Ampat, I recorded 283 fish species during a single dive near the Kri Island resorts. This is the most fishes ever seen on a single dive over a career spanning almost 30 years," Dr. Gerald R. Allen, Marine Biologist and a well-known author of marine‚Äôs books.

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Join with us came to travelthinks in facebook

message+desc:
After enjoying <Van Gogh: A Record of Ten Years Exhibition> and <Studio Ghibli's Layout Exhibition> in Yongsang, make sure to visit the National Museum of Korea.

The National Museum of Korea is the largest museum in Korea and houses the rarest and most exquisite collection of Korean cultural artifacts.

<Van Gogh: A Record of Ten Years Exhibition> will be held until Feb. 08, 2015.
<Studio Ghibli's Layout Exhibition> will be held until Mar. 01, 2015.

Get your tickets here: http://bit.ly/11YqxlX
http://bit.ly/1zXaot7

The scenery around the museum also is so stunning. Breathtaking. message+desc:
Azalea-Festival April 5th to May 6th

Nezu shrine(Tokyo-Yanesen Area) will celebrate its Azalea Festival (tsutsuji-matsuri). There will be 100 sorts, 3000 Azaleas and many kinds of food/ flower/ tea wagons. Yanesen is a historic area of Tokyo. You can also enjoy walking around, finding old temples, traditional wooden houses, small old-styled pubs with nice meal and a drink.
Tokyo Yanesen Area
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/yanaka_nezu_sendagi_hongo.html
Great Opportunities for Sightseeing on Foot, within a Day's Travel from Tokyo
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/1402/stroll.html
comments: LOVE The AZALEA FESTIVAL in TOKYO!

message+desc:
HOW TO ENTER:
1) Read these four articles about some of the places the Pope will be visiting this August:
   Article #1 ‚Üí http://bit.ly/1tbB7yN
   Article #2 ‚Üí http://bit.ly/1yz4oGu
   Article #3 ‚Üí http://bit.ly/1wBPZqn

comments:
I love Korea because it is the only country in the world that rose from poverty to become an economical power in this day and age and south Korea is a living testament of economical, political power in our modern day error, Korea will always be the Soul of Asia that is the reason why i love.It is calm, warm, polite, clean but without missing some Asian chaos; the people is incredibly nice and the food.. the food is amazing! Temples are beautiful and lots of mountains and parks around the country you can enjoy. It is a very safe place to travel around and cities have also interesting vibes and stuff going on.Korea is almost completely mountainous. Where the cities end, the mountains begin,I admire the way South Korea developed itself, it was a very poor country not so long ago.I want to visit south korea as just for the opportunity to experience a culture that is so different from our western cultures. Korea, even if it is a small country, has its unique culture, where traditions and innovations, old and new coexist. I would love to see  Haemieupseong Fortress, Rock-carved Triad Budha, Gaesimsa Temple .i want to see the 600 yr old hoya tree .i want  to take my  time in savoring the tranquility of this picturesque temple. Vasant Bokadia Gautam Jain Soni Shashi Hastimal Jain$$I would love to visit the birth place of Catholicism and learn about the beginning of Catholicism in Korea so Solmoe Holy Ground in Dangjin would be my  place of choice and I would take Kamoy Mclean Anna Marlok and Andrea Danciu with me <3 !!~$$I would love to take a break away from the busy city and visit the temples in Seosan Chungcheongnam-do  and also the Ganwoldo island with Nima Mudey, Rebecca and Rezwana Latif$$Definitely I want to visit Haemieupseong Fortress and Gaesimsa Temple with Aneta, Amby and Rochelle, Let's do it and travel to one of the most amazing country in this world!$$I love Korea but not just Korean I love all sorts of Asian cultres and one thing that I really like about Korea is the food, music, clothes, people, language. I love Kpop too but you people shouldn't bash people for liking or "worshiping" the singers that why there called "Kpop idols" and there is more music to Korea than Kpop. I hope one day I get to visit over there and see things like there Buddhist shrines and some of there Malls (Dongdaemoon, Namdaemoon, ETC.) Korea is a nice place and people  love it because Korea has a lot to offer! i have 2 reasons why i wanted to go there: 1) they are pretty much a "green" environmental community. 2) it's the technology capitol of the world!! moreover they seem to have the best looking people within asia from shows and things I've watched. But this is because beauty is something that they value over talent in so many entertainment industries. would love to visit as its my dream destination.e to see suncheon bay as Suncheon Bay is home to countless plants and marine life .i want to see Suncheon Bay Reed Festival that  is held every year in October, and ive heard that the bay is just as beautiful and charming any other month of the year.. as i love marine life it wud interest me much.  Vijaya Sakhala  Chandrakala Mutha Hemant Kataria Kavita Bokadia Gyan Jain$$Although I was in Korea more then 10 times, unfortunately I have never been inside the Myeongdong Cathedral and I have not been to Seosan city. I thinks it is a city with a very long history starting from Baekje period. But of course there are much more places which I have not seen yet. Recently many foreigners visit Seoul but for many non-Asian foreigners the biggest attraction is a countryside, Buddhist temples, places that coloured with oriental beauty, not the contemporary midernity, although DDP is gourgeous as well. Let's go see Korea one day together –ù–∞—Ç–∞–ª—å—è –ü–æ—Ö–æ–ª–∫–æ–≤–∞ Daria Nevskaya –ò–≤–∞–Ω –°–∏—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–Ω$$I guess Seosan is the place to be. Seems so beautiful!
